title: i'm curious if rioters will still play a 1000th game milestone
body: as the title says i'm curious if any rioters will play with me on my 1000th game. i just finished my 985th tonight. i'll be ant the 999th later tonight. do rioters still do this?

replies.body: Do Rioters only play for the 1000th win? or 1000th game?
How do you tell how many games you've played? All I see is normal or ranked wins?

> How do you tell how many games you've played? All I see is normal or ranked wins?

Look to the right of the scoreboard. Your wins are above your teams KDA and your losses are above your enemies KDA. Your losses are right next to your wins.
Is this for that specific game mode? So I would have to play a normal game to see normals and a ranked to see ranked? Also, is it just for this season, or total?

> Is this for that specific game mode? So I would have to play a normal game to see normals and a ranked to see ranked? Also, is it just for this season, or total?

....Yes. Normals is normals is for normals. Ranked is for ranked. ARAM for ARAM. Dominion for Dominion. Co-Op is for Co-Op, and so on. Ranked is this season only. (Though you can view your past season ranked stats from the Leagues tab and switching to the other years.) Also, when you go in custom matches, it will only show your normal wins/losses. Custom matches don't count (whether solo custom vs 5 bots or 5v5). The wins/losses on every mode is total from the creation of your account (So you could also count the number of total ranked matches you did each season through the Leagues tab and add them all up so count how many total ranked you've ever done). So you could basically see how many Summoner Rift matches you've done and so on. Like if you have 233 wins and 267 losses, that's a total of 500 normal matches. Oh, and Team Builder is also only Team Builder (will not show your other normal wins). Normal Blind/Normal Draft do count together though.
At the end of a match it will tell you how many wins and losses  you have for that particular game type in largish numbers below the XP bar. Other than that, my guess is as good as yours.

that's fantastic :D i'll make a new post once i hit the milestone.

and my apologies, i meant to type 1000th win :P my bad.
